info.title: PowerBI Administration
info.description: Provides access to the Power BI Admin API for performing administrative tasks like examining workspaces, datasets, reports and dashboards (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/power-bi/admin)

isOnDedicatedCapacity.description: Is the group on dedicated capacity

get.description: Returns a list of workspaces for the organization

parameters.name: $expand
parameters.x-ms-summary: Use the expand property to expand certain properties in the group return object.
parameters.description: Use the expand property to expand certain properties in the group return object.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Use the filter parameter to filter groups on a property. In the default example this will contain a filter to get only groups of type 'Workspace'.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Use the top parameter to set the top n results

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: Use the top parameter to skip the first x amount of groups that are being returned.

modelUrl.description: A URL to the dataflow definition file (model.json)

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filters the results, based on a boolean condition

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Use the top parameter to set the top n results

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: Use the top parameter to skip the first x amount of groups that are being returned.

get.description: Returns a list of dataflows for the organization

connectionString.description: The connection string for this data source

datasourceId.description: The bound datasource id. Empty when not bound to a gateway

gatewayId.description: The bound gateway id. Empty when not bound to a gateway.

value.description: Returns a list of datasources for the specified dataflow.

get.description: Returns a list of datasources for the specified dataflow

parameters.name: dataflowId
parameters.description: The dataflow id

value.description: Returns a list of dashboards for the organization.

get.description: Returns a list of dashboards for the organization.

parameters.name: $expand
parameters.description: Expands related entities inline, receives a comma-separated list of data types. Supported: tiles

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filters the results, based on a boolean condition

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Use the top parameter to set the top n results

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: Use the top parameter to skip the first x amount of groups that are being returned.

200.description: Get tiles of a specified dashboard

rowSpan.description: number of rows a tile should span

colSpan.description: number of columns a tile should span

reportId.description: The report id. Available only for tiles created from a report.

datasetId.description: The dataset id. Available only for tiles created from a report or using a dataset; for example, Q&A tiles.

value.description: Returns a list of tiles within the specified dashboard.

get.description: Returns a list of tiles within the specified dashboard

parameters.name: dashboardId
parameters.description: A Power BI dashboard ID

value.description: Returns a list of reports for the organization.

get.description: Returns a list of reports for the organization

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filters the results, based on a boolean condition

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Use the top parameter to set the first n results

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: Use the top parameter to skip the first x amount of groups that are being returned.

value.description: Returns a list of dashboards from the specified workspace.

get.summary: Get Dashboards In Group As Admin
get.description: Returns a list of dashboards from the specified workspace

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: The workspace id

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filters the results, based on a boolean condition

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Use the top parameter to set the first n results

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: Use the top parameter to skip the first x amount of groups that are being returned.

modelUrl.description: A URL to the dataflow definition file (model.json)

value.description: Returns a list of dataflows from the specified workspace.

get.summary: Get Dataflows In Group As Admin
get.description: Returns a list of dataflows from the specified workspace

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: The workspace id

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filters the results, based on a boolean condition

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Use the top parameter to set the first n results

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: Use the top parameter to skip the first x amount of groups that are being returned.

value.description: Returns a list of reports from the specified workspace.

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: The workspace id

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filters the results, based on a boolean condition

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Use the top parameter to set the first n results

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: Use the top parameter to skip the first x amount of groups that are being returned.

get.summary: Get Reports In Group As Admin
get.description: Returns a list of reports from the specified workspace

addRowsAPIEnabled.description: Whether the dataset allows adding new rows

isEffectiveIdentityRequired.description: Whether the dataset requires an effective identity. This indicates that you must send an effective identity using the GenerateToken API.

isEffectiveIdentityRolesRequired.description: Whether RLS is defined inside the PBIX file. This indicates that you must specify a role.

isOnPremGatewayRequired.description: Dataset requires an On-premises Data Gateway

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filters the results, based on a boolean condition

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Use the top parameter to set the first n results

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: Use the top parameter to skip the first x amount of groups that are being returned.

get.description: Returns a list of datasets for the organization

addRowsAPIEnabled.description: Whether the dataset allows adding new rows

isRefreshable.description: Whether the dataset can be refreshed

isEffectiveIdentityRequired.description: Whether the dataset requires an effective identity, which you must send in a GenerateToken API call

isEffectiveIdentityRolesRequired.description: Whether row-level security is defined inside the Power BI Desktop report (.pbix) file. If so, you must specify a role.

isOnPremGatewayRequired.description: The dataset requires an on-premises data gateway

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: The workspace id

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filters the results, based on a boolean condition

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Use the top parameter to set the first n results

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: Use the top parameter to skip the first x amount of groups that are being returned.

parameters.name: $expand
parameters.description: Expands related entities inline

get.summary: Get Datasets In Group As Admin
get.description: Returns a list of datasets from the specified workspace

name.description: (Deprecated) The data source name. Available only for DirectQuery

connectionString.description: (Deprecated) The data source connection string. Available only for DirectQuery.

datasourceId.description: The bound data source ID, which is empty when not bound to a gateway

gatewayId.description: The bound gateway ID, which is empty when not bound to a gateway. When using a gateway cluster, the gateway ID refers to the primary (first) gateway in the cluster and is similar to the gateway cluster ID.

get.summary: Get Data Sources for Dataset as Admin
get.description: Returns a list of datasources for the specified dataset.

parameters.name: datasetId
parameters.description: The ID of the Dataset
parameters.x-ms-summary: Enter the The ID of the Dataset

RecordType.description: The type of operation indicated by the record as per management API schema (PowerBI is always 20)

CreationTime.description: The date and time in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) when the user performed the activity.
CreationTime.title: CreationTime

Operation.description: The name of the user or admin activity.
Operation.title: Operation

OrganizationId.description: The GUID for your organization's Office 365 tenant. This value will always be the same for your organization, regardless of the Office 365 service in which it occurs.
OrganizationId.title: OrganizationId

UserType.description: The type of user that performed the operation.
UserType.title: UserType

UserKey.description: An alternative ID for the user identified in the UserId property.
UserKey.title: UserKey

Workload.description: The Microsoft 365 service where the activity occurred.
Workload.title: Workload

UserId.description: The UPN (User Principal Name) of the user who performed the action (specified in the Operation property) that resulted in the record being logged
UserId.title: UserId

Activity.description: The name of the user or admin activity.
Activity.title: Activity

ItemName.description: Name of the item where the event occurred.
ItemName.title: ItemName

WorkSpaceName.description: The name of the workspace where the event occurred.
WorkSpaceName.title: WorkSpaceName

DatasetName.description: The name of the dataset where the event occurred.
DatasetName.title: DatasetName

ReportName.title: The name of the report where the event occurred.

WorkspaceId.description: The guid of the workspace where the event occurred.
WorkspaceId.title: WorkspaceId

ObjectId.description: Name of the object where the event occurred.
ObjectId.title: ObjectId

DatasetId.description: The guid of the dataset where the event occurred.
DatasetId.title: DatasetId

ReportId.description: The guid of the report where the event occurred.
ReportId.title: ReportId

IsSuccess.description: Indicates whether the event completed successfully
IsSuccess.title: IsSuccess

DistributionMethod.description: For report views which distribution method did the user leverage to access it.
DistributionMethod.title: DistributionMethod

ConsumptionMethod.description: Describes the method used to consume the content such as Power BI Web App.
ConsumptionMethod.title: ConsumptionMethod

SensitivityLabelId.description: The guid of a sensitivity label assigned to this object
SensitivityLabelId.title: SensitivityLabelId

OldSensitivityLabelId.description: The guid of the old sensitivity label assigned to this object
OldSensitivityLabelId.title: OldSensitivityLabelId

ClientIP.description: The IP address of the device that was used when the activity was logged
ClientIP.title: ClientIP

UserAgent.description: Information about the user's client or browser.
UserAgent.title: UserAgent

DataConnectivityMode.description: The connection mode used (DirectQuery or Import)
DataConnectivityMode.title: DataConnectivityMode

LastRefreshTime.description: The time a dataset was last refreshed successfully
LastRefreshTime.title: LastRefreshTime

DataflowName.description: The name of the data flow where the event occurred.
DataflowName.title: DataflowName

DataflowId.description: The Id of the data flow where the event occurred.
DataflowId.title: DataflowId

DataflowType.description: The type of data flow where the event occurred.
DataflowType.title: DataflowType

DashboardName.description: The name of the dashboard where the event occurred.
DashboardName.title: DashboardName

DashboardId.description: The Id of the dashboard where the event occurred.
DashboardId.title: DashboardId

DatasetId.title: The guid of the dataset where the event occurred.

DatasetName.title: The name of the dataset where the event occurred.

GatewayId.description: The guid of the on-prem gateway used in this event
GatewayId.title: GatewayId

DatasourceId.description: The guid of the data source used for an import
DatasourceId.title: DatasourceId

ImportSource.description: The type of data source used for an import
ImportSource.title: ImportSource

ImportType.description: The format of the data source used for an import
ImportType.title: ImportType

ImportDisplayName.description: The name of data source used for an import
ImportDisplayName.title: ImportDisplayName

RefreshType.description: The type of reshresh (on demand or scheduled)
RefreshType.title: RefreshType

TargetWorkspaceId.description: The guid of the workspace where a report is cloned to
TargetWorkspaceId.title: TargetWorkspaceId

CopiedReportName.description: The name of a copied report
CopiedReportName.title: CopiedReportName

CopiedReportId.description: The guid of a copied report
CopiedReportId.title: CopiedReportId

ArtifactName.description: Report friendly name. As at time of event being raised.
ArtifactName.title: ArtifactName

get.description: Returns a list of audit activity events for a tenant

parameters.name: startDateTime
parameters.description: Date format must be yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.000Z and enclosed in single quotes

parameters.name: endDateTime
parameters.description: Date format must be yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.000Z and enclosed in single quotes

parameters.name: continuationToken
parameters.description: Continuation token

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filters the results, based on a boolean condition

id.description: The object ID of the refreshable
id.title: id

startTime.description: The start time of the window for which summary data exists
startTime.title: startTime

endTime.description: The end time of the window for which summary data exists
endTime.title: endTime

refreshCount.description: The number of refreshes within the summary time window
refreshCount.title: refreshCount

refreshFailures.description: The number of refresh failures within the summary time window
refreshFailures.title: refreshFailures

averageDuration.description: The average duration in seconds of a refresh within the summary time window
averageDuration.title: averageDuration

medianDuration.description: The median duration in seconds of a refresh within the summary time window
medianDuration.title: medianDuration

refreshesPerDay.description: The number of refreshes (schedule+onDemand) per day within the summary time window with at most 60
refreshesPerDay.title: refreshesPerDay

endTime.description: DateTime of termination (may be empty if refresh is progress)
endTime.title: endTime

serviceExceptionJson.description: Failure error code in json format (not empty only on error).
serviceExceptionJson.title: serviceExceptionJson

requestId.description: The identifier of the Refresh request.
requestId.title: requestId

times.description: Times to execute the refresh within each day
times.title: times

localTimeZoneId.description: The ID of the time zone to use
localTimeZoneId.title: localTimeZoneId

notifyOption.description: Notification option at scheduled refresh termination
notifyOption.title: notifyOption

get.description: Returns a list of refreshables for the organization within a capacity.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Number of records to return

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: ID of Group

parameters.name: datasetId
parameters.description: ID of Dataset

id.description: The gateway ID. When using a gateway cluster, the gateway ID refers to the primary (first) gateway in the cluster. In such cases, gateway ID is similar to gateway cluster ID.
id.title: id

get.description: Get On Prem Gateways: Note this API requires gateway admin permissions
